body:
- feat: login with a wallet
- feat: fix package json


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
	- Introduced digital wallet authentication for login and registration, allowing users to connect with popular wallet providers.
	- Enhanced OAuth flows to flexibly handle additional query parameters, improving authentication options when billing is enabled.

- **Style**
	- Updated authentication layouts with adjusted spacing for a more balanced and responsive display.
	- Added refined visual cues for wallet-based sign-in, ensuring a seamless and intuitive user experience.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

</details>

> [!CAUTION] > ## Review failed > > The pull request is closed. ## Walkthrough This pull request updates the authentication flow by adding query parameter support to the OAuth endpoints. It extends the AuthController, AuthService, and ProvidersInterface to accept additional parameters, and it introduces a new WalletProvider with methods for link generation, token validation, and user retrieval. Furthermore, provider factory logic is enhanced to load the new WalletProvider. On the frontend, layout adjustments, new UI components, and conditional wallet provider loading have been implemented. The database schema now includes a WALLET option, and new dependencies for Solana wallet integration and cryptographic operations have been added. ## Changes | File(s) | Change Summary | |---------|----------------| | apps/backend/src/api/routes/auth.controller.ts
apps/backend/src/services/auth/auth.service.ts
apps/backend/src/services/auth/providers.interface.ts | Updated method signatures to add an optional query parameter to oauthLink and generateLink methods. | | apps/backend/src/services/auth/providers/providers.factory.ts | Extended provider factory to include a new case for WALLET, loading the WalletProvider. | | apps/backend/src/services/auth/providers/wallet.provider.ts | Added WalletProvider class with generateLink, getToken, and getUser methods, including Redis challenge storage and signature verification logic. | | apps/frontend/src/app/auth/layout.tsx | Adjusted layout height from 614px to 660px. | | apps/frontend/src/app/global.scss | Introduced new CSS class (.tbaom7c) to hide elements. | | apps/frontend/src/components/auth/login.tsx
apps/frontend/src/components/auth/register.tsx | Updated conditionals to incorporate wallet functionality via WalletProvider with dynamic importing and new variable (billingEnabled). | | apps/frontend/src/components/auth/providers/placeholder/wallet.ui.provider.tsx
apps/frontend/src/components/auth/providers/wallet.provider.tsx | Added new UI component (WalletUiProvider) and wallet provider component to support wallet connection and authentication. | | libraries/nestjs-libraries/src/database/prisma/schema.prisma
package.json | Added WALLET to the Provider enum; added dependencies for Solana wallet integration (wallet-adapter, bs58, tweetnacl). | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant Client participant AuthController participant AuthService participant ProviderFactory participant WalletProvider participant Redis User->>Client: Initiate wallet login Client->>AuthController: Request oauthLink (with provider & query) AuthController->>AuthService: Forward provider & query parameters AuthService->>ProviderFactory: loadProvider(provider) ProviderFactory-->>AuthService: Return WalletProvider instance AuthService->>WalletProvider: Call generateLink({ publicKey, ...query }) WalletProvider->>Redis: Store generated challenge (with expiration) WalletProvider-->>AuthService: Return generated challenge (link) AuthService-->>AuthController: Return OAuth link with wallet challenge AuthController-->>Client: Send OAuth link response ``` ## Possibly related PRs - gitroomhq/postiz-app#568: Enhancements to query parameter handling in OAuth methods, similar to adding new parameters in AuthController and AuthService. - gitroomhq/postiz-app#563: Introduction of a new provider class (FarcasterProvider) that parallels the WalletProvider functionality with generateLink support. ## Poem > I'm a little rabbit with code so fine, > Hopping through queries, one step at a time. > Wallets now dance with a cryptic beat, > Challenges stored before the feat. > With bugs behind and features in view, > I celebrate changes with a happy "WOO-HOO!" > 🐇💻🎉 ---

✨ Finishing Touches - [ ] 📝 Generate Docstrings (Beta)

🪧 Tips ### Chat There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai): - Review comments: Directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example: - `I pushed a fix in commit , please review it.` - `Generate unit testing code for this file.` - `Open a follow-up GitHub issue for this discussion.` - Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples: - `@coderabbitai generate unit testing code for this file.` - `@coderabbitai modularize this function.` - PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples: - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.` - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and generate unit testing code.` - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.` - `@coderabbitai help me debug CodeRabbit configuration file.` Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks. For a focused discussion, use review comments to chat about specific files and their changes, instead of using the PR comments. ### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments) - `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR. - `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews. - `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository. - `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again. - `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR. - `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to [generate docstrings](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/finishing-touches/docstrings) for this PR. ([Beta](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/early-access#beta)) - `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments. - `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository. - `@coderabbitai help` to get help. ### Other keywords and placeholders - Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed. - Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description. - Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically. ### CodeRabbit Configuration File (`.coderabbit.yaml`) - You can programmatically configure CodeRabbit by adding a `.coderabbit.yaml` file to the root of your repository. - Please see the [configuration documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/guides/configure-coderabbit) for more information. - If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: `# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/schema.v2.json` ### Documentation and Community - Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit. - Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback. - Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.
